result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony W Ricci was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony W Ricci

records.addlTxt:
9:37 AM Defendant Anthony W Ricci in court.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible on file. Defendant indicates he has contacted multiple lawyers and cannot afford what the retainers are. 
State indicates there is not a file at this time. 
Defendant asks for an ordinance. 
State indicates if the defendant wishes to resolve today he can plea to the charge for $100+Costs. 
Defendant indicates he does not wish to enter a plea to a theft but would be willing to enter a plea to another criminal charge and pay costs today. 
State moves to amend to a criminal DC charge. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defendant indicates he wishes to accept the offer. 

Court holds colloquy with defendant about waiving right to an attorney. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 947.01(1)- GUILTY.
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$200 fine+ Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, payment plan $100/month beginning 11/1/22.
Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 Recordings
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with victim store WALMART except for restitution purposes. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. 

DEFENDANT IS TO SIGN A COPY OF THIS BOND AND THAT COPY NEEDS TO BE RETURNED TO THE RACINE COUNTY CLERK'S OFFICE FOR FILING. YOU CAN MAIL IN THE BOND TO 717 WISCONSIN AVE, RACINE, WI 53403 OR YOU CAN DROP IT OFF AT THE TRAFFIC AND MIS. OFFICE AT 717 WISCONSIN AVE, RACINE, WI 53403.

9:25 AM Defendant Anthony W Ricci in court.  Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
